title: Club World Cup Round of 16
body_text:
Club World Cup — Round of 16
Varied kick-off times across the United States for the first knockout stage of Fifa's 'showpiece' club moneyfest:
Saturday 28 June 2025
17:00 Palmeiras 1 - 0 Botafogo — DAZN
21:00 Benfica 1 - 4 Chelsea — DAZN
Sunday 29 June 2025
17:00 PSG 4 - 0 Inter Miami — Ch 5; DAZN
21:00 Flamengo 2 - 4 Bayern Munich — Ch 5; DAZN
Monday 30 June 2025
20:00 Inter Milan 0 - 1 Fluminense — Ch 5; DAZN
Tuesday 1 July 2025
02:00 Manchester City 3 - 4 Al-Hilal — Ch 5; DAZN
20:00 Real Madrid 1 - 0 Juventus — DAZN
Wednesday 2 July 2025
02:00 Borussia Dortmund 2 - 1 Monterrey — DAZN
Note: the following content is not moderated or vetted by the site owners at the time of submission. Comments are the responsibility of the poster. Disclaimer ()
Posted
28/06/2025 at
17:08:32
Another half-empty stadium for this All-Brazilian clash.
Don't know many of them, with Palmeiras apparently favoured but Botafogo have not lost in the last five games head-to-head.
At least it seems reasonably competitive in a typical South American fashion.
Fucking Collina among the Fifa elite on show... I just threw up my cream tea all over the keyboard.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
17:21:18
Yeah, but they're playing in the wrong stadium. It's the home of the NFL champion Eagles and seats 68k. Neither of these clubs has much US following, and most of them are in Miami, not Philly.
Now that was a South American challenge.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
18:10:28
Good shout Mike. My first visit to Miami surprised me, although it shouldn't have. There were parts, even in the downtown where Spanish was the first language. It was only when they realised you could speak native, they reverted to English.
Spanish was spoken a lot in San Antonio, Texas, where I spent a lot of time with work, but not as much as in Miami. Default was English.
I think what you say indicates, that they could have planned this competition better in terms of where teams play.
Never mind, we're off to Accrington Stanley next month and I've got my ticket!! I hope we don't get summer rain. There doesn't seem to be too much roof coverage.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
18:53:35
I stepped away to watch the Rugby… then an episode of
The Gold.
Say what you want about the BBC, the entire thing is brilliant — writing, casting, filming, characterisation — all six episodes are brilliant.
And we haven't even started Series 2!
I hope they go straight to penalties!
Posted
28/06/2025 at
19:10:05
Danny, I can't imagine why the warm, gentle summer rain so common in England would impact your pleasure in watching the game!
(Kidding, of course.)
Have a great time.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
19:17:39
Oh wow... somebody scored.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
19:38:43
Danny, contact me when you arrive in Accrington. I owe you big time. Or if you need a lift from Merseyside for the Accrington game, get yourself to Southport and I’ll drive you from there.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
20:16:19
Danny and Brent, hope to see you both at Accrington. Are you going to Blackburn also? I see both games have since sold out.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
20:18:51
Neil. Yes I’ll be at Blackburn as well.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
20:47:48
Hope to see you there too Brent
Posted
28/06/2025 at
21:04:09
Yes, I'm at both.
Posted
28/06/2025 at
21:16:52
Off topic sorry but yesterday I took my wife to Chester Zoo*
As she’d never been before. I wore that special edition light blue Goodison tee shirt and the number of blues I met and said hello was heartwarming. I don’t know if anyone else has noticed though but the large label with the short history in the back neck of the shirt is fcuking uncomfortable. When it’s hot it sticks to your skin as it’s plastic. I think I’ll save it for winter when I can wear an undershirt.
* Chester Zoo prides itself as the best zoo in Europe. Most of the animals were in hiding, in fact the only one we saw was a small dog. My wife thought it was a Shih Tzu.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
09:28:24
Mark, you would have to visit Oslo Zoo to get the same "hello" if you had the redshite shirt!!!
Posted
29/06/2025 at
10:39:16
We switched over to watch the last 15 minutes of the Chelsea match after Germany v England U21s.
When they called the teams off the pitch with 4 minutes of normal time remaining, we couldn't be bothered and decided to call it a night.
It was only when I woke up this morning and realised they held the players up in the changing room for two hours, before getting them back on the pitch.
Ridiculous. Why not abandon? At 86 minutes, the result would have stood. Very unhappy Chelsea manager and rightly so.
Brent, thank you for the kind offer. I'll be up at my sisters for the week, but will take you up on that kind gesture. Looking forward to seeing you and Neil and anyone else travelling, with our bottles of milk.
Mark, on dogs. I picked up my new addition last Tuesday. He's a beauty. I refrained from calling him Sheedy. I would have heard the discontent from the heavens. I wanted a German name, but I've been outvoted by family and he's got an Italian name; Enzo. So now I have Francessca Bella and Enzo. Lion Hunters!!
Posted
29/06/2025 at
16:09:24
Danny, did you get the new dog from the pound as a sort of salvage hunter?
Posted
29/06/2025 at
17:11:59
Savage Rhodesian Ridgeback hunters Alan! Unfortunately for them, no Lions near us, so they make do with do with urban foxes and squirrels. One of my previous was a master and caught a few squirrels if she got them in the open!!
I was looking at the fixtures for this competition for this evening. I might take in Flamengo v Bayern.
As I looked on the BBC Sport website, I the Women's International friendlies were listed underneath.
Australia v Slovenia
England v Jamaica
USA v Republic of Ireland
Jesus. Could the organisers not arrange something more regional? They make Hartlepool v Plymouth on a Wednesday night a short trip.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
17:40:34
Pretty goal by PSG.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
17:53:43
Its pretty pointless this Club World Cup.
A phenomenal young PSG side doing what they want against what appears to be a 'Legends' Miami team. Could realistically be 10 nil at HT.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
19:03:34
Utterly boring competition.
However, PSG movement forwards off the ball shows that you don't have to pass chuffing backwards all the time — please, football teams, learn from it...
Posted
29/06/2025 at
20:45:48
Do we hold some sort of hope of attracting a South American youngster?
I have forgotten the name and the club — any ideas?
Posted
29/06/2025 at
21:05:30
Posted
29/06/2025 at
21:24:33
Looked like a pretty good strike by Harry Kane there... but it took a jammy deflection off a foot and snuck in at the post.
Might get interesting as I imagine the Brazilians will really have a go now. Maybe Michael Oliver will make some horrendoous decisions to turn the game…???
Posted
29/06/2025 at
21:35:43
What an absolutely brilliantly worked goal from Flamengo. Just scintillating... an absolute rocket over Neuer's head.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
21:41:28
Second chance Flamengo have had to break at speed... but absolutely no-one running up in support of the lone man taking the ball forward.
Posted
29/06/2025 at
21:47:56
Great strike by Goretzka restores 2-goal lead for Bayern.
Really poor foul on Kane. Probably worth a red card.
Posted
30/06/2025 at
19:39:11
@21 Thanks Brendan
Posted
01/07/2025 at
20:42:02
Alexander Arnold is shocking at defending.
He's also now got 'Trent' on the back of his shirt. How long before his mate has 'Jude'.
Hope Real Madrid get battered.
